text:
Submitted by admin on 10/20/2015 @ 2:52 PM   Ticket Down 
COSTA MESA, Calif., Oct. 20, 2015 /PRNewswire-iReach/ -- Ticket Down is a reputable source of authentic tickets for The Lion King and this beloved musical will be performing live at the Segerstrom Center in Costa Mesa, California from now through Sunday, November 1st. 
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151020/278733LOGO 
The play is based off the Disney animated film from 1994 and is produced by Disney Theatrical. The music heard during the play is from Elton John with the lyrics coming from Tim Rice. The musical score for the traveling show is from Hans Zimmer and the entire production is directed by Julie Taymor. The first time the show was held was in 1997 at the Orpheum Theatre in Minneapolis, Minnesota and the show has now had countless sold out performances at the New Amsterdam Theatre and the Minskoff Theatre. This Broadway show has also won countless awards in every imaginable category. 
Those who are familiar with the Broadway version of the show will notice a few changes that are essential for a travelling show including a smaller sun during the opening scene, smaller stages and pit orchestra areas, and parts of the show like the Pride Rock which would come up from the stage in New York City have been changed at the show being held at the Segerstrom Center. 
The Segerstrom Center is located at 600 Town Center Drive in Costa Mesa. The venue was originally built in 1986 and it has a seating capacity of 3,000. During 2015 some of the events which this venue will host include: Lion King, Ina Garten, 42nd Street and The Nutcracker. In 2016, residents of the Costa Mesa metro area can enjoy seeing Riverdance, If/Then, The Illusionists and Wicked at the Segerstrom Center.
